result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney R Tomes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.
5/23/17 - Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.

To commit no further law violations during the period of the agreement. No contact with T.L. except as is necessary regarding the interests of their child.
5/23/17 - To commit no further law violations during the period of the agreement. No contact with T.L. except as is necessary regarding the interests of their child. To consume no alcoholic beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Not to drive any m/v unless or until her license has been reinstated.

To pay the costs of the action. ($311.50). Costs shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts office on or before 1/01/17.
5/23/17 - Costs shall be paid on or before 1/01/18.

Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two.
5/23/17 - Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two.

5/23/17 - Complete an Alcohol and/or Other Drug Abuse (AODA) Assessment with a certified Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor, at an appropriate counseling or treatment center and willingly cooperate in any recommended counseling or treatment. The defendant must ensure that the counselor sends the written results of said assessment to the District Attorney's Office on or before 7/01/17. If counseling is recommended, the defendant must ensure that the counselor sends written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with any recommendation to the District Attorney's Office by 3/01/18.
5/23/17 - Take any/all medicines prescribed by a licensed physician. Cooperate with the Door County Dept. of Human Services and any existing juvenile court orders.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

11:21 AM Defendant Courtney R Tomes in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews PSI from DOC. State has no additions or corrections to PSI.  Defense advises of a few  additions/corrections to PSI.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing on July 19, 2019 at 11:15 am.

to revoke DAGPA

02:30 PM Defendant Courtney R Tomes in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at regarding revocation of deferred agreement.  Defendant not contesting motion to revoke deferred agreement.  Court vacates deferred agreement, finds defendant guilty of Domestic Disorderly Conduct.  Court orders PSI in this file along with PSI in 18-CF-26.  Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2019 at 08:30 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Courtney R Tomes appears by phone. Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell appears in person.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Court questions defendant on phone appearance.  Defendant indicates she didn't have a ride to court today.  Atty Mitchell advises he received email last night from defendants social worker indicating transportation issues with defendant.  Atty Mitchell advises defendant would like to resolve matters soon, requests plea date be set.   Defendant has a family hearing scheduled for 4/08/19.  Court sets plea hearing in 18-CF-28 and STC in this file for 4/08/19 at 2:30 pm. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

02:26 PM Defendant Courtney R Tomes in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Mitchell indicates defendant started a new medication today and he has some concerns with effects of mediction and moving ahead hearing today.  Atty Mitchell requests court set a plea/status on 4/03/19 when he'll be in court on another matter. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 3, 2019 at 10:30 am.

Per phone call from M.D., 1442 S. Jackson Street is her address, defendant is NOT living there. M.D. would like her address removed from the case.

03:19 PM Defendant Courtney R Tomes in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Mitchell advises defendant is not contesting revocation of DAGPA and is ready to proceed to sentencing.  Atty Mitchell advises defendant recently started taking a new medication which gives him cause and concern to proceed with plea in 18-CF-26.  Because of the new medication defendant is taking, Court does not feel comfortable proceeding to sentencing today in this file or taking plea in 18-CF-26.  Atty Mitchell requests another date after the first of February. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 11, 2019 at 03:15 pm.

Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

$311.50 owed as part of the DAGPA.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Courtney R Tomes in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily but withholds accepting of the plea for 1 year to allow defendant time to complete terms of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement.  Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will move, after 1 year, to amend the charge to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct and matter can be disposed by written stipulation. Court reviews DAGPA with defendant, approves and signs agreement. Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates his office has done everything they can do to try and contact defendant. He has not been able to talk to Ms. Tomes lately. State asks court to remove trial date from the calendar, would like to try and contact Ms. Tomes as she is the victim in another file. Atty Gerbers asks court to set a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber has another phone number to try for defendant, requests another pretrial date. State has no objection. Court reschedules matter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
